author: MENAFN
title: ADQ signs multi-year sponsorship agreement with Egypt’s Pyramids Football Club | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - Edelman) Abu Dhabi, UAE – 28 December 2023: ADQ, an Abu Dhabi-based investment and holding company, today announced the signing of a multi-year sponsorship agreement with Pyramids Football Club (Pyramids FC), an Egyptian Premier League professional sports club.
As part of the agreement, ADQ will be the Official Partner of Pyramids FC. Since its establishment and rebranding from Al Assiouty Sports Club in 2018, Pyramids FC has rapidly grown to become one of the high-performance football clubs in the Egyptian Premier League.
This partnership reinforces ADQ’s position as a long-term investor in Egypt, complementing its established footprint through initiatives that positively impact local Egyptian communities. Along with its portfolio companies, ADQ actively supports the development of key sectors of Egypt’s economy through its investments, demonstrating continued confidence in the country’s robust economic potential.
The sponsorship of Pyramids FC presents an additional opportunity to engage with the local population by fostering a sense of community and creating a shared purpose through sport. It adds to existing social initiatives by ADQ in Egypt including the Bridges of Hope program, established in association with Zayed Higher Organization for People of Determination and the Egyptian Ministry of Youth and Sports, which operates support centers for people of determination.
Pyramids FC’s partnership with ADQ aims to contribute to the football club's youth and junior development programs, providing aspiring athletes with essential facilities, resources and expertise for a career in professional athletics.
Anas Jawdat Albarguthi, Chief Operating Officer at ADQ, said: “Through this sponsorship, we hope to leverage the universal appeal of football to convey our passion for excellence, our belief in the importance of partnerships as well as our dedication to fostering the health and well-being of local communities. Side by side with the club’s loyal fanbase, we wish the team success and fair play for their participation in the Egyptian Super Cup, which we are following with great excitement.”
Mamdouh Eid, Chief Executive Officer of Pyramids FC, said: “Our partnership with ADQ is a testament to our commitment to fostering football excellence across all facets of our team. This multi-year sponsorship agreement signifies the beginning of a journey that will help propel the club toward greater success, enabling us to realize the long-term goals and ambitions that we have set for Pyramids FC.”
The Pyramids FC sponsorship affirms ADQ’s dedication to supporting professional sports and grassroots programs in soccer, cycling, and basketball through its partnerships with the UAE Football Association, UAE Team Emirates, UAE Team ADQ and the NBA, which are aimed at encouraging the community to embrace physical activity and adopt healthy practices.

author: Norman Shabel
title: On V-E Day, let’s remember Europe’s gratitude for U.S. military support | The American Legion
text:
At 87, I have lived through many epic world events, from the aftermath of the Great Depression to World War II and the horrors of the Holocaust. Over time, I’ve observed that our nation’s divisions over the U.S. role in armed conflicts overseas have become increasingly bitter and deep. Not since Vietnam have we seen such rage and controversy about U.S. involvement in wars abroad as we’re seeing today.
Some who oppose involvement would prefer to see conflicts resolved through diplomacy and negotiation. Others view the United States as aligning with the wrong side of history and want nothing short of a complete policy reversal. This is especially true when it comes to the Israel-Gaza war. Regardless of the political context, an important aspect gets overlooked when we disparage U.S. military involvement abroad: The invaluable, often life-saving support it brings to nations in need, and the gratitude of those who receive it.
In honor of V-E Day on May 8, I call upon Americans everywhere to remember the times in history when direct U.S. military support has been a source of celebration for those on the receiving end. I for one vividly recall the joy and gratitude expressed by Europeans in the decade following the end of World War II, in which U.S. troops had helped bring about an Allied victory in Europe. During travels to Europe in the 1950s, and in particular to France – where D-Day and the battles of Omaha Beach played out – I experienced firsthand the respect, admiration and sheer appreciation European citizens had for the American soldiers who had saved their lives. And for Americans in general by association. Even more than 10 years later, it was still fresh on peoples’ minds.
I recall how people would approach me, smiling broadly, reaching to vigorously shake my hand. “An American!” They would exclaim with awe. “Thank you! Thank you!” Even though I was too young to have fought in the war, men, women and youngsters would stop what they were doing to tell me, in broken English, what they were doing before D-Day, on it, and afterward when their lives were transformed. They would point to the sky and recount the U.S. aircraft overhead that heralded the war’s end and portended freedom. They told stories of GIs tossing them chewing gum and chocolate bars from the back of jeeps as they drove by, and the tears of gratitude that welled in their eyes.
My novel “The Badger Game” – one of eight I have authored – reflects this sentiment in scenes set on Omaha Beach during that fateful battle and at the Normandy American Cemetery, where a bronze statue of an unknown American soldier with his arm and rifle pointing skyward pays tribute to the American troops who helped end the war.
War is always controversial. There are good guys and bad guys. There are winners and losers. Tax dollars spent. As the world’s leading military power, the United States will inevitably find itself at the crosshairs, time and again, of opposing opinions worldwide. But that must not prevent us from honoring the good that comes from intervening to protect U.S. allies, respond to acts of aggression, prevent terrorism or stop the spread of weapons of mass destruction. Actions aimed at these specific goals are overwhelmingly favored by public opinion.
On V-E Day, let’s recall Europe’s gratitude at the end of World War II as a way to remember and honor the positive impact our actions can have. ** About Norman Shabel Norman Shabel is the author of eight novels, praised by Judge Andrew P. Napolitano as “terrific, fast-paced reads about the dark side of law enforcement and the judiciary.” Many of his stories are inspired by his 55-year career as a plaintiff’s attorney and prosecutor, where he witnessed injustice and oppression on a daily basis; others draw on his experiences of Jewish family life and his astute observations of its unique, often hilarious, dynamics. Also a prolific playwright, Shabel has written seven plays, three of which have been produced off-Broadway in New York City, Philadelphia and Florida to rave reviews. Born in Brooklyn, N.Y., Norman is retired from law and splits his time between New Jersey and Florida. He finds much joy spending time with his adult children and grandchildren.

author: 台股老高
title: 台股殺破年線！重挫300點 台積電倒地、矽光子撐盤抗跌｜台股老高 - 聚財網
text:
相關個股：鴻海(2317)、台積電(2330)、波若威(3163)、新日興(3376)
美國聯準會（Fed）如預期維持利率不變，並釋出全年仍預計降息兩次的訊號，雖無驚喜，但中東地緣政治風險未解，加上美股四大指數漲跌互見，讓全球市場氛圍持續偏保守，台股今（19）日再度陷入震盪整理，盤中一度重挫300多點、跌破年線支撐。
台股今日早盤以22,238點開出，隨後走勢疲弱，指數一路走低，盤中最低下探至21,981點，跌幅一度超過1%，呈現開低走低格局。權值股方面，台積電未能延續填息氣勢，盤中最低觸及1,030元，跌幅超過2%，鴻海、聯發科等大型電子權值股也同步走弱，成為拖累大盤的主因之一。
雖然指數重挫，但中小型個股表現相對活躍，AI與矽光子（CPO）族群逆勢突圍，包括新日興、富世達、上詮、波若威等均上漲3%以上，支撐盤面熱度。法人指出，6月底前將有逾200檔個股除息，現金股利總額超過5,000億元，投信與集團股季底作帳行情仍有機會提供支撐。
技術面來看，台股近期呈現「漲增跌縮」的格局，儘管今日下跌，但成交量約落在3,300億元水位，量縮反映殺盤力道有限。分析師蔡明翰指出，市場對於Fed暫不降息、中東局勢不穩等不確定因素仍抱持觀望態度，外資雖有買超，但同步以期貨空單避險，顯示偏多態度仍不明朗，預料台股短線難以轉強，將維持橫向震盪走勢。
整體來看，在權值股壓盤、年線失守的情況下，台股短線仍處於震盪整理階段。不過，市場呈現量縮下跌、低檔有撐的技術結構，加上投信季底作帳啟動，具備基本面優勢的AI、伺服器、矽光子等中小型成長股，有望吸引資金轉向。操作上，建議投資人保守看待大盤波動，聚焦具有未來性與籌碼優勢的族群個股。

author: Geeta Pillai
title: Human Rights Alarm Over Military Deployment for Election Security in El Salvador
text:
Court Nullifies PDP's Candidacy in Ebonyi South Bye-Election: Onu Alleges Political Motivation
Human Rights Alarm Over Military Deployment for Election Security in El Salvador
El Salvador, a nation with a history of armed conflict, teeters on the brink of a contentious electoral process. Human rights organizations have raised alarm bells over the deployment of military personnel for security tasks during the elections set for February 4 and the upcoming municipal elections in March. By law, only the National Civil Police (PNC), with 22 thousand members active on voting day, should be tasked with security duties. Yet, military forces have been spotted in various locations in the capital, including near Cuscatlán Park, around Rosales Hospital, and in parts of the historic center.
Military Involvement in Public Security: A Cause for Concern
Gabriela Santos, director of the Human Rights Institute of the UCA (Idhuca), has expressed disquiet about the military’s involvement in public security. She fears that this action could cultivate an environment of fear, intimidation, and potential repression. Santos pointed to past instances of sexual abuse against girls and excessive use of force by the military during the emergency regime, indicating the possible dangers of such a deployment.
Controversy Surrounding Bukele’s Presidency
The presidency of Nayib Bukele has been riddled with allegations of human rights abuses and power concentration. Human rights groups and advocates have voiced concerns about the authoritarian tactics employed by Bukele’s administration, which include mass detentions and the suspension of rights. Despite a decrease in the homicide rate, the long-term democratic risks associated with Bukele’s increasing control over every branch of El Salvador’s government raise serious concerns.
Democracy at Risk?
While improved security is a positive development, the potential erosion of democratic processes and the normalization of militarized public security is worrisome. The presence of the military during an electoral process sends a strong signal about the state of democracy in El Salvador. As the country heads towards the upcoming elections, the world watches with bated breath, hoping that the rights and freedoms of the Salvadoran people are upheld, and their democratic processes remain untarnished.

author: CCG
title: Kamilah Mitchell of 'Teas with Meaning' crafts healing tea blends with purpose
text: OAKLAND, Calif. -- Whatever the feeling or emotion, Kamilah Mitchell of Oakland's Teas with Meaning has a special blend to match it. Her handcrafted tea types share thoughtfulness and intentionality in every cup. "I have a tea for smiles, tears, health, real conversations," described Mitchell. "I really believe that tea time gives you the power to slow down." Teas with Meaning began in 2018 following Mitchell's cancer diagnosis. The news lead her to discover the wellness benefits of various herbs found in tea. "I have friends who have land in Mount Shasta, California, so I went there to kind of just grieve and process the news," recalled Mitchell. "In the midst of processing the news, it was the first day of fall, so I recognized that we have everything we need around us...there was just a lot of harvest." She added, "I just took the time to learn more about the things that I would need on the spiritual and physical journey to fight the battle of cancer." Mitchell started one cup of tea at a time, creating organic loose leaf teas and nourishing tea-infused products with magic and meaning as the main ingredients. One of her most popular offerings is "DiviniTea," a black tea blend popular for invigorating the mind, body, and spirit. "I tell people it's better than your favorite chai, and I mean that," Mitchell said about DiviniTea. "You can see the grapefruit, you can see the orange, you can see the cardamom." The process for creating the renowned blends revolves around seasonal ingredients. "We focus on the quality of ingredients," shared Mitchell. "We also focus on what is available organically and ethically sourced." She continued, "I started to create a blend a month just to get the community's feedback, as well as to learn more about what the community needs." Teas with Meaning regularly teams up with the community to foster creativity and share food and drink with purpose. "I've collaborated with over 30 Black-owned, minority-owned businesses in the past 6 years," Mitchell said. Her most recent project, in collaboration with Visit Oakland, showcases a tea blend that best represents the neighborhoods within The Town. "With each blend and each neighborhood, I took the time to talk to Oakland natives in those communities to see what they thought tea time would represent for their neighborhood," stated Mitchell. "With the support, help, and push of Visit Oakland, I created 'The Town Teas.'" Mitchell doesn't consider herself a business owner, but instead refers to herself proudly as the "Tea Lady." "Tea lady with a passion," she said. "To have my own business reminds me of what the power of community is." For more information, visit here and follow @teaswithmeaning on Instagram.

author: Evan Craig
title: Rams must bring back key veteran in wake of Derion Kendrick injury
text: The [Los Angeles Rams](https://www.turfshowtimes.com/) were dealt a tough blow after [cornerback Derion Kendrick reportedly tore his ACL](https://www.turfshowtimes.com/2024/7/25/24205941/rams-cb-injuries-derion-kendrick-tre-white). LA’s secondary was already stretched thin entering training camp and Kendrick likely being lost for the year further puts the unit in a bind. While the news is undoubtedly painful for the Rams, Les Snead must make the right move by reuniting with Ahkello Witherspoon. I pray Derion Kendrick did not tear his ACL…Just an awful awful injury and really unfortunate if so. With that said this would be a significant loss.— JAKE ELLENBOGEN (@JKBOGEN) [#Rams]need depth. Felt Ahkello Witherspoon was needed back on the roster before this. Now? Get him back PRONTO! [July 25, 2024] To echo the words of TST’s own Jake Ellenbogen — GET WITHERSPOON BACK PRONTO! The eight-year veteran was an underrated addition for Los Angeles after coming over from the [Steelers](https://www.behindthesteelcurtain.com/). Witherspoon recorded career highs in combined tackles (52), passes defensed (14), interceptions (3) and fumbles recovered (2) [in 17 regular season starts](https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/W/WithAh00.htm). He realistically could have been a [Pro Bowl](http://www.sbnation.com/nfl-pro-bowl) alternate during his lone season in Hollywood. The Colorado product played lights out for a Rams team that needed a spark in the secondary. Now, Witherspoon might be called upon again on short notice to hold down the fort with Kendrick sidelined. Bringing him back is really the only right answer to this problem. There will be plenty of name dropping until Snead can find a suitable replacement. One big-name free agent who could be a solution is [Super Bowl](https://www.sbnation.com/super-bowl) champ and 2019 Defensive Player of the Year, Stephon Gilmore. Despite closing in on his mid-30s, Gilmore has remained quite productive at his age. Including the postseason, Gilmore has started 34 games [since the start of the 2022 campaign](https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/G/GilmSt00.htm) and snagged two interceptions in back-to-back years with the Colts and Cowboys. The vet got absolutely cooked against the [Packers](https://www.acmepackingcompany.com/) in last year’s playoffs, which could amount to being a victim of the Cowboys’ postseason curse. Another option much closer to home is Tre Tomlinson [who played just 5% of the defensive snaps](https://www.pro-football-reference.com/players/H/HodgTr00.htm) in his rookie campaign. An in-house option like Tomlinson might be an attraction option, yet a risky one at that if the second-year defender isn’t up to the task. Better to be safe than sorry when it comes to the secondary. Signing an All-Pro talent off the open market has got to be tempting for Snead, but the only logical move is for LA to reunite with Ahkello Witherspoon. Someone with knowledge of the system is invaluable and it could be argued that the Rams should have never let him slip away to begin with.

author: 小浪财讯
title: 谱尼测试跌2.62%，成交额1.27亿元，近3日主力净流入-3720.93万|汽车_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
8月14日， 谱尼测试 跌2.62%，成交额1.27亿元，换手率4.07%，总市值46.61亿元。
异动分析
核污染防治+食品安全+军工+新能源汽车+碳中和
1、据谱尼测试官微，谱尼测试聚焦核废水关键核素，积极承担福岛核污染水排海对海洋辐射环境影响的检测任务，具备海水、沉积物与生物体、海洋水产品、食品、饮用水、矿产品、化妆品原料及成品等放射性监测能力。
2、2024年年报：食品安全检测：持续承担国家市场监管总局及多省市食品安全监督抽检任务，凭借专业技术与设备，强化对食品中微生物、农兽药残留、添加剂等安全指标检测。通过优化检测流程，提高检测效率与精准度，确保食品安全，维护消费者权益，巩固在该领域的领先地位。
3、全资子公司北京谱尼测试科技有限公司取得由北京市武器装备科研生产单位保密资格认定委员会办公室颁发的《武器装备科研生产单位保密资格申请批准通知书》。
4、公司能够为新能源汽车厂商提供汽车材料方面，整车、汽车voc检测等服务，新能源汽车检测业务包含特斯拉、蔚来、理想、小鹏等品牌。
5、公司在碳达峰预测、碳中和规划、碳盘查、碳核算、节能减排技术咨询、能源审计、节能评估等方面具有丰富项目经验，目前已协助多个省市政府开展了重点企业碳排放核查、复查、监测计划审核等工作，核查、复查企业超过450家，核查经验全面覆盖国家已有核算方法学的发电、电网、钢铁等24大行业。同时，谱尼测试还开展了多个地市的碳达峰技术路径、温室气体排放清单编制、低碳方案等课题项目。
(免责声明：分析内容来源于互联网，不构成投资建议，请投资者根据不同行情独立判断)
资金分析
今日主力净流入-1899.52万，占比0.15%，行业排名24/32，连续3日被主力资金减仓；所属行业主力净流入-4.83亿，连续2日被主力资金减仓。
区间 今日 近3日 近5日 近10日 近20日 主力净流入 -1899.52万 -3720.93万 -3862.98万 -6458.69万 -1.19亿
主力持仓
主力没有控盘，筹码分布非常分散，主力成交额6672.11万，占总成交额的2.58%。
技术面：筹码平均交易成本为8.58元
该股筹码平均交易成本为8.58元，近期该股有吸筹现象，但吸筹力度不强；目前股价在压力位8.85和支撑位8.02之间，可以做区间波段。
公司简介
资料显示，谱尼测试集团股份有限公司位于北京市海淀区锦带路66号院1号楼5层101，成立日期2002年6月10日，上市日期2020年9月16日，公司主营业务涉及检验检测、计量、认证及相关技术服务。主营业务收入构成为：生命科学与健康环保69.85%，汽车及其他消费品16.12%，安全保障8.06%，电子电气4.80%，计量1.04%，认证0.11%，其他0.03%。
谱尼测试所属申万行业为：社会服务-专业服务-检测服务。所属概念板块包括：航天军工、低空经济、基因测序、小盘、幽门螺杆概念等。
截至3月31日，谱尼测试股东户数2.15万，较上期减少5.37%；人均流通股16855股，较上期增加5.68%。2025年1月-3月，谱尼测试实现营业收入2.52亿元，同比减少24.73%；归母净利润-1.11亿元，同比减少13.26%。
分红方面，谱尼测试A股上市后累计派现3.36亿元。近三年，累计派现2.34亿元。
机构持仓方面，截止2025年3月31日，谱尼测试十大流通股东中，万家创业板2年定期开放混合A（161914）位居第五大流通股东，持股600.01万股，为新进股东。香港中央结算有限公司位居第八大流通股东，持股192.97万股，相比上期减少52.30万股。方正富邦天睿混合A（007850）退出十大流通股东之列。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->investment and opinion pieces
Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance

author: Phil Medlicott
title: Vivianne Miedema deals Chelsea first defeat of season as Man City seize first-leg lead
text:
Vivianne Miedema deals Chelsea first defeat of season as Man City seize first-leg lead
Manchester City 2-0 Chelsea: A double off the bench from the Dutchwoman ended Sonia Bompastor’s 28-game unbeaten start as Chelsea manager
Substitute Vivianne Miedema scored a brace as Manchester City inflicted Chelsea's first defeat of the season by beating them 2-0 in their Champions League quarter-final first leg at the Joie Stadium.
Miedema, having come off the bench for the start of the second half, put City in front on the hour mark, rifling in the rebound when Hannah Hampton tipped Laia Aleixandri's header against the crossbar.
And after Chelsea substitute Johanna Rytting Kaneryd had struck the bar at the other end in the 80th minute, Miedema added her second with two minutes of normal time remaining to give City a two-goal advantage heading into next Thursday's second leg at Stamford Bridge.
That match will complete a series of four successive meetings between the sides, which started with Chelsea's 2-1 triumph on Saturday in the League Cup final at Pride Park that gave them their first trophy under boss Sonia Bompastor.
They have now suffered a maiden loss of the Frenchwoman's tenure, ending an unbeaten run of 28 games since she took charge last summer - of which 26 were wins - and 31 matches in total.
City, meanwhile, have a first win of Nick Cushing's interim tenure after he replaced Gareth Taylor ahead of the quartet of fixtures, which continues with Sunday's Women's Super League clash at the Etihad Stadium.
With Khadija Shaw and Aoba Fujino dropping out having come off with injuries in Saturday's contest, Kerolin and 19-year-old Lily Murphy came into City's starting attack, while Cushing also opted to replace Miedema with Jess Park.
Bompastor made two changes which included former City midfielder Keira Walsh returning to Chelsea's line-up after three games out.
Cushing had spoken about Saturday's result serving as "fuel" for his team, and City started brightly as Kerolin shot over and Jill Roord's strike was gathered by Hampton.
Chelsea registered an attempt with Nathalie Bjorn's header being saved by Ayaka Yamashita before Hampton was called upon again twice in quick succession just prior to the half-hour, dealing with efforts from Murphy and Mary Fowler.
A Chelsea burst forward soon after ended with Catarina Macario heading over from Lauren James' cross, and the opening stages of the second half saw efforts from James and Roord saved.
City then broke the deadlock when Aleixandri sent a header goalwards from Fowler's delivery, Hampton did well to divert it against the woodwork and Miedema, who had replaced Murphy at the break, was on hand to crack the loose ball home from close range.
After Miedema saw a further shot parried by Hampton, Chelsea had the ball in the net in the 71st minute as Mayra Ramirez slotted in, but the flag went up for offside.
The visitors continued to push for a leveller and Rytting Kaneryd's shot came back off the upright and fellow substitute Weike Kaptein saw an effort parried by Yamashita, before Miedema struck again as stoppage time drew near, slotting into the corner having been fed by Kerolin.
“This should be our standard,” the Dutch striker told TNT Sports after the win. “We were really disappointed after the game on Saturday. We have had some special Champions League nights here and this one really sums it all up.
"I'm really happy that I came on. It's not bad, we all want to play Champions League. Today is special and hopefully we can put in the same performance next week. We have been getting a lot of knocks everywhere, we are missing a lot of players and I'm happy we got this result today. It gives us confidence."
PA
